storyTitle: As Quote Manager, I want the system to automatically create a new version when I edit a quote to maintain version history

testCases.title: Verify new version creation on quote edit
preconditions: User is logged in as Quote Manager with edit permissions
At least one existing quote is available in the system
Quote versions table is accessible and functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the quotes list and select an existing quote to edit
steps.expectedResult: Quote details page opens with editable fields displayed

steps.action: Modify one or more fields in the quote (e.g., price, description, terms)
steps.expectedResult: Modified fields show updated values in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Submit' button to save the changes
steps.expectedResult: System processes the edit request and displays a success confirmation message indicating version creation

steps.action: Verify that a new version record is created with an incremented version number
steps.expectedResult: New version record exists with version number incremented by 1 from the previous version (e.g., v1 to v2)

steps.action: Navigate to the version history section or execute GET /api/quotes/{id}/versions to retrieve version history for the quote
steps.expectedResult: All versions including the newly created one are listed with correct version numbers, timestamps, and user information

steps.action: Select a previous version record from the version history
steps.expectedResult: Previous version details are displayed in read-only mode

steps.action: Attempt to edit any field in the previous version record
steps.expectedResult: Editing is prevented, fields are disabled or locked, and system displays message indicating version is read-only

postconditions: New version record is stored in the quote versions table
Previous version remains intact and read-only
Version history shows complete audit trail
Current quote displays the latest edited values

testCases.title: Ensure version creation latency is within SLA
preconditions: User is logged in as Quote Manager with edit permissions
At least one existing quote is available in the system
Performance monitoring tools or timer are available to measure latency
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Navigate to an existing quote and open it for editing
steps.expectedResult: Quote details page opens with editable fields

steps.action: Make a modification to one or more fields in the quote
steps.expectedResult: Fields are updated with new values

steps.action: Start a timer and click 'Save' or 'Submit' to submit the quote edit
steps.expectedResult: System begins processing the edit request

steps.action: Monitor the time taken from submission until the system confirms version creation completion
steps.expectedResult: Version creation completes and confirmation message is displayed within 1 second of submission

steps.action: Verify that the new version record is successfully created in the database
steps.expectedResult: New version record exists with correct version number and timestamp matching the submission time

postconditions: Version creation latency is recorded and meets SLA requirement of under 1 second
New version is successfully stored in the system
User receives timely confirmation of the save operation

storyTitle: As Quote Manager, I want to view previous versions of a quote to compare changes over time

testCases.title: Verify version history list and detail view
preconditions: User is logged in as Quote Manager with appropriate permissions
At least one quote exists with multiple versions in the system
Quote versions table contains historical version data
Version history UI component is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the quotes list and select a quote that has multiple versions
steps.expectedResult: Quote details page opens displaying the current version of the quote

steps.action: Click on the 'Version History' tab or button to navigate to version history
steps.expectedResult: Version history section loads and displays within 2 seconds

steps.action: Review the list of versions displayed in the version history
steps.expectedResult: List shows all previous versions with version number, date/timestamp, and editor name for each version in chronological order

steps.action: Verify that the version list loaded within the 2-second performance requirement
steps.expectedResult: Version history list was displayed within 2 seconds from the time of navigation

steps.action: Select a previous version from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Selected version details are displayed showing all quote fields and data as they existed in that version

steps.action: Verify that the version details are displayed in read-only mode
steps.expectedResult: All fields are displayed as read-only with no edit buttons or editable input fields visible

steps.action: Attempt to click on or modify any field in the historical version view
steps.expectedResult: Fields remain uneditable, cursor does not change to edit mode, and no modification is possible

steps.action: Attempt to locate and click any 'Edit' or 'Save' buttons for the historical version
steps.expectedResult: No edit or save buttons are available, or if present, they are disabled and non-functional

steps.action: Select another previous version from the list
steps.expectedResult: New version details are displayed in read-only mode, replacing the previous view

postconditions: User has successfully viewed version history without making any changes
Historical versions remain unchanged and read-only
User can navigate back to current quote version
No data integrity issues with historical versions

storyTitle: As Quote Manager, I want to revert a quote to a previous version to correct errors or restore prior terms

testCases.title: Verify successful revert to previous quote version
preconditions: User is logged in as Quote Manager with revert permissions
A quote exists with at least 2 versions in version history
User has access to view and modify the quote
Quote is in a state that allows revert operations
API endpoint POST /api/quotes/{id}/revert is available and functional

steps.action: Navigate to the quote details page for the target quote
steps.expectedResult: Quote details page loads successfully displaying current version information

steps.action: Click on 'Version History' button or link to view all quote versions
steps.expectedResult: Version history panel/page opens showing list of all previous versions with timestamps, version numbers, and user who made changes

steps.action: Review the list of previous versions and select a specific previous version to revert to
steps.expectedResult: Selected version is highlighted and revert option becomes available for that version

steps.action: Click the 'Revert' button for the selected previous version
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog is displayed with message asking user to confirm revert action, showing details of the version being reverted to

steps.action: Review the confirmation dialog details and click 'Confirm' or 'Yes' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the revert request and creates a new version identical to the selected previous version

steps.action: Wait for system processing to complete
steps.expectedResult: Success confirmation message is displayed indicating the quote has been successfully reverted

steps.action: View current quote details on the quote details page
steps.expectedResult: Quote reflects all data from the reverted version including pricing, terms, line items, and all other fields

steps.action: Check version history again
steps.expectedResult: A new version entry appears in version history showing the revert action with current timestamp and user information

steps.action: Verify that the new version data matches exactly with the selected previous version data
steps.expectedResult: All fields in the new current version are identical to the selected previous version that was reverted to

postconditions: A new version is created in the quote version history
Current quote state matches the selected previous version exactly
Version history shows the revert action as the latest entry
All business validation rules remain satisfied
Quote remains accessible for further modifications if needed
Audit trail records the revert operation with user and timestamp
